title: The Tenant of Your Skin
premise: A reclusive archivist, hired to digitally preserve the fragmented diary of a notorious 19th-century spiritualist, begins to experience her client's memories as his own. He realizes the diary isn't a record of the past, but a meticulous instruction manual for a psychic transference—and the final entry is being written through him, in real time.
protagonist: Leo Vance, a man with Highly Superior Autobiographical Memory (HSAM), who cannot forget anything he experiences.
conflict: Leo must fight to retain his own identity and memories against an invasive consciousness that uses his perfect recall as a permanent home, while distinguishing what is real from what is being implanted, before his own mind becomes a prison for another.
setting: Present-day, a climate-controlled private archive in a converted London townhouse, with flashbacks to the fog-bound streets of Victorian London.
tone: Claustrophobic, cerebral, and unnervingly intimate, blending the dread of losing one's mind with the horror of being permanently, perfectly remembered by a malignant presence.
